attributes.comment:
I strongly object to this proposed fee increase. In particular to the huge
percentage hike for the application for permanent residence. This nation is
grappling with the issue of illegal immigration and I believe that placing yet another
obstacle in the path of those who are trying to immigrate legally would only serve
to make the problem worse. Contrary to popular belief, the immigration process is
already complex and restrictive; a complete overhaul of the process itself is
needed. In addition, the PDF document states that a fee increase would help to
keep processing times within reason, since the backlog has now been
significantly reduced. I personally know of two people who have been waiting for a
decision on their I-130 application for THREE YEARS! The table you provide in
the document shows the processing time for this application as six months.
It seems like the fee increase is punishing those who are making the effort to do
things legally.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
